QuestionStem: The butterfly’s wing looks different in each of the photos because

options.AnswerText: A. the photos were taken at different scales.
B. the wing was bent to reveal its inner structure in the last photo.
options.Feedback: The butterfly wing was not bent in any of the photos. Think about why a scientist would want to view a butterfly's wing using a microscope.

options.AnswerText: C. one photo shows the edge of the wing and one shows the middle of the wing.
options.Feedback: All of the photos show the same part of a butterfly’s wing. Think about why a scientist would want to view a butterfly’s wing using a microscope.

FinalIncorrectFeedback: When you use a microscope, structures that are too tiny to be seen at one scale can be enlarged so that they become visible.
